Case reference: 2023008747.CaseDesc: Joseph Lamartina was last seen on December 16th, 2018 when he checked out of a hotel in Niagara Falls, New York. His abandoned vehicle was located in the parking of the hotel on February 8th, 2019. He has not been heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Chain, With gold Sicilian horn
Gold, Gold, Chain, With St-Christopher medallion

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2012020048.CaseDesc: Kathleen Johnston went missing from downtown Saskatoon, SK at approximately 2:15 p.m. on October 20, 1953. Miss Johnston got off of a city transit bus on her way to work at the Gem Café in the downtown area after visiting her mother at her residence.

Case reference: 2014004874.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2006, Tracy Forde was seen for the last time at her home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004920.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004 William "Bruce" Molaski left his residence in Toronto, Ontario, in a maroon pick-up truck. A few days later, police found Mr. Molaski's truck at 16 Regatta Road in Toronto.

Case reference: 2009005099.CaseDesc: Russell Hoffert was a voluntary patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital, Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Hoffert walked away from the hospital grounds, in poor winter like weather and was not properly dressed for the conditions. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014001059.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1970, the body of a heavyset young adult male with black hair was found on the shore of Kamloops Lake in British Columbia. He had all his teeth removed during his life and had no noticeable scars or tattoos. He is believed to have drowned in the Thompson River near Riverside Park a few days earlier.

Jacket: Nylon, Light Blue, Squall brand with hood, golfer label on front with zipper
Shirt: Blue, Yellow, Corsair brand, checkered pattern
Blue, Longsleeve, Lancer Brand, Size Large, Blue with purple and black check pattern, longsleeve
White, Bluestone brand, long sleeves, size medium
Shoes: Brown, Oxfords, Vibram brand, made in Italy, with shoe laces

Case reference: 2014005378.CaseDesc: On September 8, 2004, Robert Harrington was last seen near the intersection of Oakwood Avenue and Vaughan Road in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006218.CaseDesc: Lori Kasprick, who sometimes went by "Lovey", was last seen in the mid-1970s.  She was from Hilliard and going to school in Mundare when last seen.  Lori may have had ties to Tofield and Ryley.  Her grandparents lived in Holden at that time, and Lori could have made acquaintance with others her age when going to visit.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2006013699.CaseDesc: Emile Morissette was last seen while on a fishing trip at Birch Lake in Timmins Township, Ontario on July 6, 1976.

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2014004050.CaseDesc: On Saturday, June 25, 1994, Stephen Tudor was participating in a one man (solo) sailboat race from Port Huron to Mackinac Island.  The sailboat he was sailing, the "ANERIRIN" was located abandoned along the Goderich, Ontario shoreline. Police were unable to locate any signs of Mr. Tudor.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2018060326.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2018, sisters Bérénice and Bérengère Paré were last seen at the Ottawa International Airport in Ottawa, Ontario. Bérénice and Bérengère, along with their mother, boarded a flight destined for Russia to visit with family. To date, the siblings have not been returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2006019099.CaseDesc: Janet Derbyshire was last seen on December 4, 1976, in St. Joseph Island near Sault Ste. Marie, ON.  She was  seen jumping off the St. Joseph's Island Bridge into the  water. She was seen floating downstream for approximately .25 miles before she submerged under water. Janet Derbyshire is presumed drowned but her body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2019040207.CaseDesc: On July 16, 2015, Denis Chernov was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Before he was reported missing, Denis had not been seen or heard from for four years.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2006021799.CaseDesc: Leo Payash, aged 8, was last seen on July 01, 1957. He and his mother Cecilia Payash, aged 48 years, were walking on Red Lake Road and neither has been seen since.

Deformity: Nose, Described as having a "hooked" nose

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2019081392.CaseDesc: Casey Badger was last seen leaving his home in Edmonton, Alberta, on January 28, 2020. He was travelling on foot and wrapped in a blanket.

Scar: Right Forearm, Multiple scars on right forearm
Tattoo: Left Chest, Psalms 23 on left chest
Left Cheek, Cross on left cheek

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002591.CaseDesc: Richard Kelly Little went missing on May 23, 1997. Richard was last seen at residence in Port Coquitlam. Richard was also known to be transgender.

Case reference: 2014003890.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1973, Guy Carignan was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia with a female friend. His family reported him missing on May 28, 1980. Investigations were conducted in Edmonton, Alberta and Vancouver, British Columbia. Law enforcement were unable to locate Guy or his female friend.

Case reference: 2014001384.CaseDesc: On March 12, 1974, Gilles Larose was seen for the last time in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2023011363.CaseDesc: Isabella (Rui) Dan was last seen around 8 p.m. on March 3, 2023. According to a witness, it is alleged she asked for a ride to an intersection thought to be in the Town of Markham, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2014004546.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2004, Roy Lewis was last seen hitchhiking in Sackville, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2008002899.CaseDesc: On September 4, 1998 Melvin Spence, an offshore laborer, left the farm he was employed at and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018046253.CaseDesc: On January 31, 1997, at approximately 4:30pm, Daphne Powell was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Daphne left her residence with two suitcases, some money and indicated that she was going to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2008019999.CaseDesc: Patrick O’Connell has been missing since July 4, 2008. He was last seen by a friend and roommate. Patrick suffers from schizophrenia, substance abuse issues, and has previously made comments that he may harm himself.

Case reference: 2021002686.CaseDesc: On January 12, 2021, shortly after 5:00 pm, Brock Curtis was last seen at the Prospect Point in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. Several witnesses observed Brock jumping into the falls, and being swept away.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2014003708.CaseDesc: John Kane was last seen March 29th, 1994, when he left his residence to go to work at the Saint John Regional Hospital. John never arrived for his shift, which was unusual for him. John was a heavy drinker and gambler. He would become depressed when drinking, and threatened suicide in the past.

Case reference: 2014005453.CaseDesc: On December 9, 2004, Sheila Adamo was seen for the last time when she left the family residence in Ottawa, Ontario. She is known to travel to the East Coast as well as into the United States.

Case reference: 2014002590.CaseDesc: On April 15, 2000, Merlin Labrie was seen for the last time as he left a gathering with friends in Levis, Quebec. Merlin was supposed to meet up with a friend, but he never did and has not been seen since.

Mark: Head, Multiple beauty marks on the face

Case reference: 2018023712.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2018, Elsa Vargas was last seen near her home in Chateauguay, Quebec. Ms. Vargas also has citizenship in Costa Rica.

Mark: Right Cheek, Mole on the right side

Case reference: 2011001499.CaseDesc: At the time of his disappearance, Luke Joly-Durocher was visiting friends in North Bay, Ontario. He resides in Temiskaming, Quebec. Video surveillance showed Luke being refused entry into Cecil's Eatery and Beer Society at approximately 11:54 p.m. He left by himself and has not been seen or heard from since that time.

Belt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Studded belt, black on the front and purple around the waist
Shirt: Grey, T-shirt, may have had a small purple animal logo on the bottom corner
Deformity: Right Forearm, Thinner than left forearm

Case reference: 2014002164.CaseDesc: Michael Strang was last seen November 21, 1990. Strang was a patient at Centracare psychiatric hospital where he reportedly left from a 3rd story window. Strang has not been heard from since.

Tattoo: Winged Heart - not sure which arm

Case reference: 2014004567.CaseDesc: Marten Wenzel was last heard from by his family in August of 2004. Marten was known to contact his family at least once a month. During the time of his disappearance, Marten was living in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978 at his residence in Edson. Mr. Nodeland’s motorcycle and helmet were recovered approximately one month later in a remote area south west of Sundre, Alberta. Mr. Nodeland may have been seen on foot in the area a short time later however he was never located.

Case reference: 2006010999.CaseDesc: It is believed that Sander Lingman became lost while staking claims near Gripp Lake, 69 kilometres north west of Nakina, Ontario. They were unable to find Mr Lingman, despite intensive searches of the area.

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred

Case reference: 2013000096.CaseDesc: On May 6, 1972 a four man fishing and trapping team was returning from Lynn Lake on dog sleds after purchasing supplies. Mr. Bonner and his friend were in the lead sled. The team that was traveling with them was approximately 2.5 km behind. When approximately 183 metres from Mr. Bonner's sled, they noticed both men had gone through the ice. Once on scene both men had disappeared beneath the water. One of the men was pulled from the water but could not be revived. Mr. Bonner never resurfaced and despite dragging operations he could not be located.

Case reference: 2014001015.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 25 to 30 years old, was found in the County of Wellington on the grounds of a private club called "Clearwater Enterprises Ltd.". His post-mortem length was measured at 5’8”-5’10”, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was a heavy smoker. He was estimated to have been there since August-late September the previous year.

Other: Single blade pocket knife with inscription "Niagara Falls"

Case reference: 2014001178.CaseDesc: The body of this adult male was found floating in the Fraser River near Prince George, British Columbia, on July 10, 1967. He wore upper dentures and it is believed he was in the water seven to ten days.

Pants: Blue, Suit Style, Dress pants with large metal buttons
Shoes: Black, Oxford, Pointed Shoes, size 7 or 8

Case reference: 2014005883.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1996, André Pellerin was seen for the last time in the Nouveau-Rosemont district in Montreal, Quebec. He left his residence in the morning to go to a shopping mall. André suffers from mental health issues and must take his medication every day. When he left his home, he had no medication with him.

Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Three-quarter length

Case reference: 2020011480.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1988, Amerk Barbarian was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Amerk had been seen by his landlord for the last time when his rent was collected.

Case reference: 2021022554.CaseDesc: Muoi Nguyen was last seen on January 5, 1990 and was reported missing on January 12, 1990. Police have not been able to locate Muoi NGUYEN.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, Saskatchewan, on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002401.CaseDesc: Jane was a student at Laurentian University in Sudbury, Ontario. She was last seen on August 9, 1975, in her apartment just before she went to bed at 2:00 a.m. The next day she was not seen or heard from, and was reported missing. Her personal belongings were left behind. It appears that Jane may have been a victim of foul play.

Scar: Forehead, Small round scare between the eyebrows.

Case reference: 2020009588.CaseDesc: On February 8, 1989, at approximately 7:30am, Soekarmia Sarbirja was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Soekarmia was to attend an immigration hearing on February 10, but did not show up.

Case reference: 2022019657.CaseDesc: On January 9, 1989, Richard Figura was seen for the last time near the brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Richard was despondent.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2020015970.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2017, John Spratt was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. John is known to be homeless, and has been diagnosed with some serious health issues. John would always check in with his family every couple of years, however, they have not heard from him since 2017.

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2012020082.CaseDesc: Katelyn Noble was last seen in the Radisson, SK district in mid August, 2007. Katelyn has had no contact with her family or friends in Mission, BC, and her whereabouts are unknown.

Case reference: 2014002842.CaseDesc: On August 17, 1971, Stella St. Arnault was seen for the last time as she ran into a treed area in John D’or Prairie Reserve in Alberta. Prior to her disappearance, Stella had had an argument with a family member.

Case reference: 2012020121.CaseDesc: Mathieu Beauregard Messier was alone at home with his wife. At approximately 7:00 p.m., Mathieu told his wife he had to go see a friend and that he would be back later in the evening. He left alone in his wife’s vehicle and with her cellphone. At approximately 10:30 p.m., police received a call that a vehicle was on fire on Rang du Haut-de-la-Rivière, near the military base in Farnham, Quebec. The vehicle was identified as that of Mathieu’s wife. There was nobody inside the vehicle, and Mathieu has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001333.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, members of the Canadian Armed Forces located the personal belongings of William Bereziuk washed up on an island in the Athabasca River 50 km north of Fort McMurray, Alberta. Mr. Bereziuk left Edmonton, Alberta in October of 1974 with the intention of making a canoe trip down the Athabasca River. He informed family members that he intended to spend the winter of 1974 in the Birch Mountain area of Alberta and would return to Edmonton in August of 1975. Mr. Bereziuk has never been heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Crucifix or scapular

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003507.CaseDesc: On February 5, 1991, Brian Adrain was seen for the last time. Brian’s abandoned vehicle was found west of Millarville, also known as McLean Creek, in the Kananaskis area in Alberta.

Case reference: 2016044292.CaseDesc: Chenel Dubé was last seen on August 10, 1970 in Montreal, Quebec. That evening, he called his mother to tell her that he would be home later. Chenel's vehicle was found 3 days later in the parking lot of a restaurant in Ville Saint-Laurent, Quebec.

Case reference: 2020009613.CaseDesc: On March 6, 1989, Marcelo Onorato was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Marcelo was visiting from Argentina and was due to return there on March 12, but he never boarded his flight.

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2014005450.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1979 James Gordon Nevin departed from his residence in Amherstburg, Ontario heading west for a 2 week vacation with the intention of visiting relatives. Mr. Nevin had a grandson in Winnipeg, Manitoba and a son in Prince George, British Columbia. Neither relative had prior notification Mr. Nevin's intentions to visit.   On June 14, 1979 the RCMP responded to a call and James Nevin's vehicle, a 1974 white/maroon Dodge Coronet, was located in a ditch between Rocanville, Saskatchewan and St. Lazare, Manitoba. Inquiries reveal the vehicle was at this location since June 8, 1979.   Mr. Nevin has never been seen again and likely went missing between 1:30 pm and 3:00 pm on June 8, 1979. Extensive searches were conducted by land and air all with negative results. James Gordon Nevin was never seen again. Foul play cannot be ruled out.

Scar: Right Thumb, Skin graft scar on right or left thumb

Case reference: 2008023599.CaseDesc: Gordon Andrew Cameron was reported missing by a family member on March 26, 1993. He was last seen on February 28, at Lino's Restaurant and has not been seen or heard from since.  At the time of his disappearance he was self-employed as an auto-body repairman. His shop was located at Brule Road and Highway 2 in Kingston. Foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2013000104.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of March 8, 1985, an unidentified male was seen walking on the Miles Hart Bridge. Ten minutes later, one witness returned only to discover a pile of clothing. The clothing was later identified as belonging to Mr. Beardy. It is assumed Mr. Beardy took his own life, however his remains have never been recovered. No foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2015035404.CaseDesc: On the morning of June 27, 2015, Curtis Wilson was seen for the last time by a friend in Kelowna, British Columbia. Mr. Wilson had travelled from Alberta to British Columbia in a black rental car, model Chrysler 200. Subsequently, the rental was recovered in an area off Cosen Bay in the Kalamakla Provincial Park in Coldstream, British Columbia.

Shirt: Black, TSHIRT, Orange logo on front of shirt
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Skull in top hat 'Wicked'; skull outer forearm
Right Forearm, Skull with snake through it, $$ signs & flaming skull
Left Chest, Eagle head; upper chest
Left Forearm, Red & black scorpion on inside forearm
Right Upper Arm, Three skulls, inside bicep
Right Upper Arm, Skull, outside bicep

Case reference: 2014002160.CaseDesc: Jackelene Bylow was last seen at her residence on November 13, 1994 after having dinner at a restaurant near Willington Ave and Hastings St. She suffers from mental illness and addicted to drugs and alcohol.

Tattoo: Chest, Duck and blue bird on right breast

Case reference: 2014001900.CaseDesc: Andre Gauthier was last seen at approximately 10:15 pm the evening of September 23, 1984 near Simms Corner on the west side of Saint John, NB.

Other: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Lighter with "Andre" engraved on the front, "July 10, 1984, Irene + Paul" on the back

Case reference: 2014004742.CaseDesc: On January 9, 2006, Michael James Bosma left on foot from a care home located on Bernard Avenue in Kelowna, BC and failed to return.  Mr. Bosma had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and required essential medication.  ATM activity was recorded on his account during the night and early morning hours following his departure then all traces of him ceased.

Case reference: 2014043144.CaseDesc: On August 3, 2014, Aaron Dragonetti was seen for the last time in the downtown area of St. John’s Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2014005536.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of March 25, 1996, Renée Simard was seen for the last time as she left her family home in Matane, Quebec. Renée had indicated that she was going for a walk, and at approximately 2:30 p.m. she was seen near the wharf along the Matane River at the mouth of the St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2014004934.CaseDesc: On February 28, 1976, at approximately 5:30 pm, Jean Cardinale was seen for the last at the Bayview Village Plaza in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2020007818.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1972, at approximately 12:00pm, Harvey Tulley was seen for the last time by the building’s superintendent in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Harvey was despondent.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Thumb, Bent towards index finger

Case reference: 2014003363.CaseDesc: At 2:00 a.m. on April 21st, 1992, Hilda BEAUDOIN and her brother left the Beagle Lounge in Mary's Harbour, NL on a single snowmobile to ride across the sea ice near coastal waters in efforts to return to St. Lewis, NL. They did not arrive at their destination. Snowmobile tracks were discovered leading into open water near St. Lewis where the snowmobile and her brother's body were later recovered from the ocean waters.

Case reference: 2016032179.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1944, Richard David was seen for the last time riding his bike in front of his family’s home in Etobicoke, Ontario. Later that evening, when Richard’s mother returned home, his bike was found at the house. Richard was a good child at home, and in school, and had no reason to run away.

Socks: Cotton, Grey, Yellow band at top

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2014003613.CaseDesc: Larry Mattis was last seen when he was taken to the Edmonton airport by a friend and dropped off for a flight to Toronto.

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar
